tag_list: james-endicott, entrepreneur, utah, byu, startup, ceo
overview:
James Endicott is the Founder/CEO of SHIPZI

James has served on the board of various private entities. Most recently, James made an Angel investment and joined the board of eBusinessPlan.comand DentistNet. James is the former CEO of Exact Wave and Qualified Address. He continues his business efforts within SHIPZI as well as several technology projects, including operating Serento Ventures, a private investment company.

As part of his commitment to non-profit organizations and community affairs, James is serving on the board of Advisors for ACE - The Academy for Creating Enterprise, The JKPD Foundation, and still serves as a Founder for the Rollins Center for Entrepreneurship & Technology at Brigham Young University. James has served as the a faculty Advisor to the Business Plan Competition in the Marriott School of Management at BYU. He is also a member of the Utah Technology Council, Young Presidents Organization, and dedicates significant time to educational, church, and the Boy Scouts of America.

Throughout his business career James has been honored as a finalist for the Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year in 2010, a vSpring 100 Entrepreneur on multiple occasions, a MWCN Utah 100 Honoree on multiple occasions, and has been featured by Utah Business Magazine and Utah Valley BusinessQ magazine as a top 40 Under 40 business leader. James has also been featured in the Wall Street Journal as well as other national and regional publications. EXACT WAVE was honored in 2008 as Utah’s 21st fastest growing company.

James is a graduate of Brigham Young University and The David Eccles School of Business at the University of Utah.
